publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-308# Brian Adam: Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004-That the Parliament welcomes the decision of Scotland's local history societies to hold a local history week from 18 to 24 April 2004 with a focus on graveyards; notes the great public interest in local and family history, and encourages the Scottish Executive and local authorities to be involved in promoting these events as part of the genealogy tourism initiative. Supported by: Mark Ballard*
S2M-308# Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004 (lodged on 8 September 2003) Stewart Stevenson*, Michael Matheson*

S2M-308# Brian Adam: Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004—That the Parliament welcomes the decision of Scotland's local history societies to hold a local history week from 18 to 24 April 2004 with a focus on graveyards; notes the great public interest in local and family history, and encourages the Scottish Executive and local authorities to be involved in promoting these events as part of the genealogy tourism initiative. Supported by: Mark Ballard, Stewart Stevenson, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-308# Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004 (lodged on 8 September 2003) Chris Ballance*, Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-308# Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004 (lodged on 8 September 2003) John Swinburne*

S2M-308# Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004 (lodged on 8 September 2003) Mr Rob Gibson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr David Davidson*, Elaine Smith*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-308# Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004 (lodged on 8 September 2003) Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-308# Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004 (lodged on 8 September 2003) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-308# Local Family History Week 18 to 24 April 2004 (lodged on 8 September 2003) Dr Jean Turner*
